channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-13028] Cleanup mapreduce API changes
item.description:
The API changes made in HBASE-12798 need to be cleaned up so their common use makes more sense.

  • initialize should take some kind of configuration object that can be used in setting up a Connection (e.g. JobConf)
  • initialize should be called at the start of getSplits and getRecordReader rather than across the class when a member is needed
  • the same changes should be present in the mapred package since it is not longer deprecated
  • examples should rely on idiomatic MapReduce (specifically they should not be relying on JobConfigurable to get a JobConf instance)

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
it looks like there's a bunch of drift between the mapreduce and mapred APIs.

Unless someone objects, I'm going to limit this ticket's scope to just the initialization stuff. I'll file a follow on with pointers on the rest of the things that need to be ported over to the mapred implementation.
Is this blocker for 1.0, or can we fix this in 1.0.1?
I've had to breaking change an API that's new in 1.0. I could possible work around this in 1.1, but it would be ugly.
Ok, do you have a patch for this yet?
yeah, just getting the test to pass with the api change in place for the example
patch for master

customfieldvalues.customfieldvalue: The bindings for reading data from HBase using both the Hadoop MapReduce mapred and mapreduce libraries now are initialized the same way. Subclasses wishing to build on TableInputFormatBase that use the new initialize method will have access to job configuration information.
